verses.verse: Thus the heavens<WH8064> and the earth<WH776> were finished<WH3615>, and all the host of them<WH6635>.

And on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> God<WH430> ended<WH3615> his work<WH4399> which he had made<WH6213>; and he rested<WH7673> on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> from all his work<WH4399> which he had made<WH6213>.

And God<WH430> blessed<WH1288> the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117>, and sanctified<WH6942> it: because<WH3588> that in it he had rested<WH7673> from all his work<WH4399> which God<WH430> created<WH1254> and made<WH6213>.

¶ These<WH428> are the generations<WH8435> of the heavens<WH8064> and of the earth<WH776> when they were created<WH1254>, in the day<WH3117> that the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> made<WH6213> the earth<WH776> and the heavens<WH8064>,

And every plant<WH7880> of the field<WH7704> before<WH2962> it was in the earth<WH776>, and every herb<WH6212> of the field<WH7704> before<WH2962> it grew<WH6779>: for<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> had not<WH3808> caused it to rain<WH4305> upon the earth<WH776>, and there was not<WH369> a man<WH120> to till<WH5647> the ground<WH127>.
But there went up<WH5927> a mist<WH108> from<WH4480> the earth<WH776>, and watered<WH8248> the whole face<WH6440> of the ground<WH127>.

And the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> formed<WH3335> man<WH120> of the dust<WH6083> of<WH4480> the ground<WH127>, and breathed<WH5301> into his nostrils<WH639> the breath<WH5397> of life<WH2416>; and man<WH120> became a living<WH2416> soul<WH5315>.
¶ And the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> planted<WH5193> a garden<WH1588> eastward<WH6924> in Eden<WH5731>; and there<WH8033> he put<WH7760> the man<WH120> whom<WH834> he had formed<WH3335>.

And out<WH4480> of the ground<WH127> made<WH6779> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> to grow<WH6779> every tree<WH6086> that is pleasant<WH2530> to the sight<WH4758>, and good<WH2896> for food<WH3978>; the tree<WH6086> of life<WH2416> also in the midst<WH8432> of the garden<WH1588>, and the tree<WH6086> of knowledge<WH1847> of good<WH2896> and evil<WH7451>.
And a river<WH5104> went out<WH3318> of Eden<WH5731> to water<WH8248> the garden<WH1588>; and from thence it was parted<WH6504>, and became into four<WH702> heads<WH7218>.
The name<WH8034> of the first<WH259> is Pison<WH6376>: that<WH1931> is it which compasseth<WH5437> the whole land<WH776> of Havilah<WH2341>, where<WH834> there is gold<WH2091>;
And the gold<WH2091> of that<WH1931> land<WH776> is good<WH2896>: there is bdellium<WH916> and the onyx<WH7718> stone<WH68>.
And the name<WH8034> of the second<WH8145> river<WH5104> is Gihon<WH1521>: the same is it that compasseth<WH5437> the whole land<WH776> of Ethiopia<WH3568>.

And the name<WH8034> of the third<WH7992> river<WH5104> is Hiddekel<WH2313>: that is it which goeth toward<WH1980> the east<WH6926> of Assyria<WH804>. And the fourth<WH7243> river<WH5104> is Euphrates<WH6578>.
And the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> took<WH3947> the man<WH120>, and put him<WH3240> into the garden<WH1588> of Eden<WH5731> to dress<WH5647> it and to keep<WH8104> it.
And the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> commanded<WH6680> the man<WH120>, saying<WH559>, Of every tree<WH6086> of the garden<WH1588> thou mayest freely<WH398> eat<WH398>:

But of the tree<WH6086> of the knowledge<WH1847> of good<WH2896> and evil<WH7451>, thou shalt not eat<WH398> of it: for in the day<WH3117> that thou eatest<WH398> thereof thou shalt surely<WH4191> die<WH4191>.
¶ And the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> said<WH559>, It is not good<WH2896> that the man<WH120> should be<WH1961> alone; I will make<WH6213> him an help meet<WH5828> for him.

And out of the ground<WH127> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> formed<WH3335> every beast<WH2416> of the field<WH7704>, and every fowl<WH5775> of the air<WH8064>; and brought<WH935> them unto Adam<WH120> to see<WH7200> what he would call<WH7121> them: and whatsoever Adam<WH120> called<WH7121> every living<WH2416> creature<WH5315>, that<WH1931> was the name thereof<WH8034>.

And Adam<WH120> gave<WH7121> names<WH8034> to all cattle<WH929>, and to the fowl<WH5775> of the air<WH8064>, and to every beast<WH2416> of the field<WH7704>; but for Adam<WH120> there was not found<WH4672> an help meet<WH5828> for him.

And the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> caused<WH5307> a deep sleep<WH8639> to fall<WH5307> upon Adam<WH121>, and he slept<WH3462>: and he took<WH3947> one<WH259> of his ribs<WH6763>, and closed up<WH5462> the flesh<WH1320> instead thereof;
And the rib<WH6763>, which the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> had taken<WH3947> from man<WH120>, made<WH1129> he a woman<WH802>, and brought<WH935> her unto the man<WH120>.

And Adam<WH120> said<WH559>, This<WH2063> is now<WH6471> bone<WH6106> of my bones<WH6106>, and flesh<WH1320> of my flesh<WH1320>: she<WH2063> shall be called<WH7121> Woman<WH802>, because she<WH2063> was taken<WH3947> out of Man<WH376>.
Therefore<WH3651> shall a man<WH376> leave<WH5800> his father<WH1> and his mother<WH517>, and shall cleave<WH1692> unto his wife<WH802>: and they shall be one<WH259> flesh<WH1320>.
And they were both<WH8147> naked<WH6174>, the man<WH120> and his wife<WH802>, and were not ashamed<WH954>.
